meanings.definition: The quality or state of being irreducible.
meanings.sent1: The irreducibility of the puzzle made it challenging to solve.
meanings.sent2: The irreducibility of the problem required a creative approach.
meanings.sent3: The irreducibility of the math question left the students scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: Her irreducibility to compromise on her principles was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The irreducibility of the diamond's brilliance was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The inability to be reduced or simplified.
meanings.sent1: The irreducibility of the equation puzzled the students.
meanings.sent2: The irreducibility of the issue led to a lengthy discussion.
meanings.sent3: The irreducibility of the problem seemed to mock their efforts.
meanings.sent4: The irreducibility of her emotions made it hard to understand her.
meanings.sent5: The irreducibility of the knot in the rope made it impossible to untangle.
